Module c482performanceassessment
Package c482performanceassessment.controllers

Class ProductFormController

  • java.lang.Object
    • c482performanceassessment.controllers.BaseFormController
      • c482performanceassessment.controllers.ProductFormController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class ProductFormController
extends BaseFormController
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class is responsible for controlling all functionality relating to the product form. FUTURE ENHANCEMENT - Could add a button that adds a new part from the Add/Modify product scene.
    Author:
    Brady Bassett

        Initializes the partTable and the associatedPartTable

      • loadProductData

        protected void loadProductData​(Product product)
                        throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Fills the TextBoxes with the appropriate data from product being modified. LOGIC ERROR - AssociatedParts list was not being displayed to the table on call of loadProductData because, the initialize function was being called before loadProductData was called. This was fixed but calling initialize again from inside the loadProductData function to initialize with the provided products associatedParts list.
        Parameters:
        product - product data being loaded
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if "file:/c482performanceassessment/product-form.fxml" is not found

      • onPartSearch

                   throws java.net.MalformedURLException

      • onProductSave

        private void onProductSave​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This function sets the currentProduct values and either modifies an existing product or adds a new one to the products list.
        Parameters:
        event - ActionEvent that provides the main stage declared in main
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the main-form.fxml file is unreachable

      • onProductCancel

        private void onProductCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Removes the values in temporaryAddedParts from the currentProducts associatedParts list and adds the temporaryRemovedParts back to the currentProducts associatedParts list, and switches back to the main scene.
        Parameters:
        event - ActionEvent that provides the main stage declared in main
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the main-form.fxml file is unreachable
